intro: Heptanthus yumuriensis, commonly known as the Yumuriensis heptanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in the spring. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Heptanthus yumuriensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils.
